subject: Art
title: Value Structure
description: How the arrangement of lights and darks creates the backbone of composition.

hook.text: Squint at any masterpiece and you see 3-4 big value shapes. That pattern of lights and darks is the value structure ‚Äî and it's what makes or breaks a composition before color even enters the picture.

buildup.text: A strong value structure groups values: mostly light with dark accents (high-key), mostly dark with light accents (low-key), or a clear separation between light and dark masses.

discovery.text: The value study (notan) reduces your composition to 2-3 values: black, white, and optionally one middle gray. If the notan looks strong, the full painting will have solid bones.

twist.text: A painting with beautiful colors but weak value structure looks flat and confusing. A painting with strong value structure but dull colors still reads powerfully. Value is the skeleton; color is the clothing.

climax.text: Before your next piece, create a 2-value notan: fill shapes with solid black or leave them white. No gray. This forces you to commit to light and dark masses. If the notan reads well, proceed.

punchline.text: Get the values right and you're 80% done. Color is the easy part after that.

quiz.question: What is a notan study?
options: A 2-3 value study that maps the light and dark masses of a composition
